# Copilot Instructions

This file provides guidance for GitHub Copilot when working on this project. It helps Copilot understand your project structure, build commands, and development practices to provide better assistance.

## How to Customize

Add instructions for:

- **Project setup**: Build and test commands (e.g., `pnpm install`, `pnpm test`, `pnpm build`)
- **Code conventions**: Naming patterns, file organization, preferred patterns
- **Build tools and dependencies**: Key libraries, frameworks, and their versions
- **Testing and validation**: How to run tests, linting, type checking
- **Architecture**: Key directories, important files, and module organization
- **Common workflows**: How to add features, fix bugs, run the project locally

Keep instructions concise and factual so Copilot can quickly understand how to work in this repository.

Learn more [here](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/how-tos/configure-custom-instructions/add-repository-instructions).

## About This Project

@schplitt/starter is a minimal TypeScript starter template featuring ESM modules, Vitest for testing, and ESLint for code quality. It's designed as a lightweight foundation for building packages with strict TypeScript, automated builds via tsdown, and streamlined release workflows.
